Comment: This command info is generated from fig
Name: bazel

Arguments.Name: --autodetect_server_javabase
Arguments.Description: Back to the local JDK for running the bazel server and instead exits

Arguments.Name: --noautodetect_server_javabase
Arguments.Description: Does not fall back to the local JDK for running the bazel server and instead exits

Arguments.Name: --batch
Arguments.Description: Run as just a client process without a server

Arguments.Name: --nobatch
Arguments.Description: Run with a server

Arguments.Name: --batch_cpu_scheduling
Arguments.Description: Only on Linux; use 'batch' CPU scheduling for Bazel

Arguments.Name: --nobatch_cpu_scheduling
Arguments.Description: Only on Linux; Bazel does not perform a system call

Arguments.Name: --bazelrc
Arguments.Description: The location of the user .bazelrc file containing default values of Bazel options

Arguments.Name: bazelrc path
Arguments.Description: bazelrc path

Arguments.Name: --block_for_lock
Arguments.Description: Wait for a running command to complete

Arguments.Name: --noblock_for_lock
Arguments.Description: Bazel does not wait for a running command to complete, but instead exits immediately

Arguments.Name: --client_debug
Arguments.Description: Log debug information from the client to stderr. Changing this option will not cause the server to restart

Arguments.Name: --noclient_debug
Arguments.Description: Don't log debug information from the client to stderr

Arguments.Name: --connect_timeout_secs
Arguments.Description: The amount of time the client waits for each attempt to connect to the server

Arguments.Name: time
Arguments.Description: time

Arguments.Name: --expand_configs_in_place
Arguments.Description: Changed the expansion of --config flags to be done in-place

Arguments.Name: --noexpand_configs_in_place
Arguments.Description: --config flags in a fixed point expansion between normal rc options and command-line specified options

Arguments.Name: --failure_detail_out
Arguments.Description: Specifies a location to write a failure_detail protobuf message if the server experiences a failure and cannot report it via gRPC, as normal. Otherwise, the location will be ${OUTPUT_BASE}/failure_detail.rawproto

Arguments.Name: path
Arguments.Description: path

Arguments.Name: --home_rc
Arguments.Description: Look for the home bazelrc file at $HOME/.bazelrc

Arguments.Name: --nohome_rc
Arguments.Description: Don't look for the home bazelrc file at $HOME/.bazelrc

Arguments.Name: --idle_server_tasks
Arguments.Description: Run System.gc() when the server is idle

Arguments.Name: --noidle_server_tasks
Arguments.Description: Don't run System.gc() when the server is idle

Arguments.Name: --ignore_all_rc_files
Arguments.Description: Disables all rc files, regardless of the values of other rc-modifying flags, even if these flags come later in the list of startup options

Arguments.Name: --noignore_all_rc_files
Arguments.Description: Enables all rc files

Arguments.Name: --io_nice_level
Arguments.Description: Only on Linux; set a level from 0-7 for best-effort IO scheduling using the sys_ioprio_set system call. 0 is highest priority, 7 is lowest

Arguments.Name: io-level
Arguments.Description: io-level
io-level
io-level
io-level
io-level
io-level
io-level
io-level
io-level

Arguments.Name: --local_startup_timeout_secs
Arguments.Description: The maximum amount of time the client waits to connect to the server

Arguments.Name: seconds
Arguments.Description: seconds

Arguments.Name: --macos_qos_class
Arguments.Description: Sets the QoS service class of the bazel server when running on macOS

Arguments.Name: QoS service class
Arguments.Description: QoS service class

Arguments.Name: --max_idle_secs
Arguments.Description: The number of seconds the build server will wait idling before shutting down

Arguments.Name: seconds
Arguments.Description: seconds

Arguments.Name: --output_base
Arguments.Description: Specifies the output location to which all build output will be written

Arguments.Name: Path
Arguments.Description: Path

Arguments.Name: --output_base_root
Arguments.Description: The user-specific directory beneath which all build outputs are written

Arguments.Name: Path
Arguments.Description: Path

Arguments.Name: --preemptible
Arguments.Description: If true, the command can be preempted if another command is started

Arguments.Name: --nopreemptible
Arguments.Description: If true, the command can be preempted if another command is started

Arguments.Name: --server_jvm_out
Arguments.Description: The location to write the server's JVM's output

Arguments.Name: Path
Arguments.Description: Path

Arguments.Name: --shutdown_on_low_sys_mem
Arguments.Description: Linux only. If max_idle_secs is set and the build server has been idle for a while, shut down the server when the system is low on free RAM

Arguments.Name: --noshutdown_on_low_sys_mem
Arguments.Description: Linux only. Don't shut down the server when the system is low on free RAM

Arguments.Name: --system_rc
Arguments.Description: Look for the system-wide bazelrc

Arguments.Name: --nosystem_rc
Arguments.Description: Don't look for the system-wide bazelrc

Arguments.Name: --unlimit_coredumps
Arguments.Description: Raises the soft coredump limit to the hard limit to make coredumps of the server (including the JVM) and the client possible under common conditions

Arguments.Name: --nounlimit_coredumps
Arguments.Description: Don't raise the soft coredump limit to the hard limit to make coredumps of the server (including the JVM) and the client possible under common conditions

Arguments.Name: --watchfs
Arguments.Description: Use the operating system's file watch service for local changes instead of scanning every file for a change

Arguments.Name: --nowatchfs
Arguments.Description: Scan every file for a change

Arguments.Name: --windows_enable_symlinks
Arguments.Description: Real symbolic links will be created on Windows instead of file copying

Arguments.Name: --nowindows_enable_symlinks
Arguments.Description: Real symbolic links will be created via file copying

Arguments.Name: --workspace_rc
Arguments.Description: Look for the workspace bazelrc file at $workspace/.bazelrc

Arguments.Name: --noworkspace_rc
Arguments.Description: Don't look for the workspace bazelrc file at $workspace/.bazelrc

Arguments.Name: run
Arguments.Description: Runs the specified target

Arguments.Name: BUILD file
Arguments.Description: BUILD file

Arguments.Name: test
Arguments.Description: Builds and runs the specified test targets

Arguments.Name: BUILD file
Arguments.Description: BUILD file

Arguments.Name: build
Arguments.Description: Builds the specified targets

Arguments.Name: BUILD file
Arguments.Description: BUILD file

CustomArgumentTemplates.Name: BUILD file
CustomArgumentTemplates.Command: bash -c FILES=( $(find ./ -name BUILD) ); for f in $FILES; do echo "----$f"; \cat "$f"; done
